author: Nikhila Henry
text:
This is a different institute and the duty was entrusted on me, says Appa Rao

Podile Appa Rao is also the Chief Executive Officer and Chairman of the National Council of Rural Institutes.

Podile Appa Rao, Vice-Chancellor of the University of Hyderabad, who had to go on leave following unrest after the suicide of Rohith Vemula, a research scholar, is retaining another post equivalent to vice-chancellorship that comes directly under the Ministry of Human Resource Development. Apart from being the V-C of UoH, he is also the Chief Executive Officer and Chairman of the National Council of Rural Institutes (NCRI) in Hyderabad, an autonomous body that falls under the MHRD.

The additional charge was handed over to Mr. Rao on January 7 this year, said D.N. Dash, Member-Secretary of the NCRI.

Mr. Rao, however, said he had not applied for the post but was handed down the designation by a direct order from the MHRD. While he has not been intervening much in the office matters of the NCRI so far “due to unrest on the UoH campus,” he is actively holding the post. “This is a different institute and the duty was entrusted on me. I had not applied for it,” Mr. Rao said.

NCRI officials were, however, not able to explain the process involved in selecting Mr. Rao for the post.

The students are angry about Mr. Rao holding the additional charge.

“ The MHRD has not considered the demand that during a judicial inquiry into Vemula’s death, the V-C should not be in office,” said a JAC representative.
title: V-C retains a plum post under MHRD
